q: How many players per side in Rugby Union
hint: Standard RU is 15; Rugby League is 13.

q: A 'knock-on' occurs when the ball is
hint: Forward from the hand is a knock-on.

q: After a minor infringement, play usually restarts with a
hint: Knock-ons/forward passes → scrum.

q: Offside at a ruck is judged from the
hint: Offside line through last feet.

q: What is the 'gain line' used for
hint: Territory measure per phase.

q: Crash ball is best run by
hint: Crash lines from 12/13 into the seam.

q: On a 2‑pod, the tip option is
options: Flat pass to forward running outside shoulder
a: Flat pass to forward running outside shoulder
hint: Tip = short to outside runner.

q: 'Screen' in backs play means
hint: Ball goes behind front runner.

q: 'Unders' line breaks
hint: Angle back to inside shoulder.

q: 'Overs' line breaks
hint: Angle out to space.

q: A successful kick at goal that bounces and then goes over is a ______ kick
hint: Law / terminology basic. A successful kick at goal that bounces and then goes over is a ______ kick

q: A tackle above the shoulders is a ______ tackle
hint: Law / terminology basic. A tackle above the shoulders is a ______ tackle

q: At the lineout, players must form a ______ between 5m and 15m lines
hint: Law / terminology basic. At the lineout, players must form a ______ between 5m and 15m lines

q: When a maul stops moving forward and the ball is not immediately available, the referee usually calls a ______ maul
hint: Law / terminology basic. When a maul stops moving forward and the ball is not immediately available, the referee usually calls a ______ maul
